CatDescriptText: Mr. John Adams, 416 Calliope Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 5, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Which do you think people give priority recognition to, the acquisition of money or achievement?" answer reads: "Most people recognize the acquisition of money regardless of how it is obtained. A lot of people get money by means which people know are not right, but the people still look up to them because they have money.  Money means power and that's what the people look up to."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of John Adams wearing houndstooth coat standing in front of flecked stone wall
